    • Method Detail

      • createAOCContainer

        boolean createAOCContainer(byte secretType,
                           byte[] secret,
                           short secretOffset,
                           short secretLen,
                           short maxRetry,
                           byte[] name,
                           short appNameOffset,
                           short appNameLen,
                           byte[] expireTS,
                           short expOffset)
        Creates an Applet Object Container (AOC).

        After the creation of an AOC, any activities to import Global Users or to create non-Global Users will automatically be given administrative privileges until the container is finalized by the finzalizeContainer() method is successfully called.

        All activities other than finalizing container, importing GOC users or creating new non-GOC users would be disabled until a finalized container exist.

        Secret Type Secret Description Maximum Retry Allowed To Be Set
        CRED_CLASS_PIN Numerical PIN (0 to 9) with a maximum of 32 characters 99 maximum retry allowed to be set
        CRED_CLASS_PWD Alpha-numerical Password with ASCII printable characters with a maximum of 32 characters 99 maximum retry allowed to be set

        Parameters:
        secretType - Secret type of AOC container authentication secret
        secret - Secret buffer storing AOC container authentication secret
        secretOffset - Secret buffer offset storing AOC container authentication secret
        secretLen - Secret buffer length storing AOC container authentication secret
        maxRetry - Maximum retry for authenticating to AOC container
        name - Name buffer of the AOC container with ASCII printable non-symbolic characters allowed
        appNameOffset - Offset of name buffer
        appNameLen - Length of name buffer with maximum length of name to be 15 bytes
        expireTS - Expiry timestamp buffer for container expiration. Set expiry timestamp to 00000000 to have no expiration.
        expOffset - Offset into expiry timestamp buffer.
        Returns:
        Success or failure of creating AOC container.

      • finalizeNewContainer

        boolean finalizeNewContainer(byte[] output,
                             short outOffset)
        Finalize a newly created Applet Object Container.

        An extendedRequest() method is required to fully execute the finalization step. Only the AOC container's credential must be used in the AOC container finalization phase.

        All Global users imported or non-Global users created after the finalization of AOC container phase will automatically be given non-adminstrative privileges until an existing adminstrator promotes them with the promoteAOCUserCred() method.

        The extendedRequest() returns 1 for successful operation and 0 for failed operation.
        Parameters:
        output - 8 bytes of nonce to be signed
        outOffset - Offset of buffer storing 8 bytes of nonce to be signed
        Returns:
        8 bytes of nonce to be signed

      • destroyAOCContainer

        boolean destroyAOCContainer()
        Destroys AOC container.

        No authentication is required.

        Destroys all container objects with zeroization of all objects and clearing of all keys stored in the AOC container. All non-Global credentials are zeroized and their PIN/Password cleared as well.

        All registered applets should call this method to clear up their own AOC container slot for future applets as a due diligence.

        AOC containers that do not clear up their AOC container slots but have already uninstalled their applets can be manually cleared using APDU call to the KM101 applet.

        Forceful eviction and destruction of the AOC container would proceed when APDU command for clearing orphaned AOC containers has been called without needing authentication.
        Returns:
        Result regarding successful or failure to destroy an AOC container

      • manageAOCContainer

        boolean manageAOCContainer(byte fieldType,
                           byte[] input,
                           short offset,
                           short len,
                           byte[] output,
                           short outOffset)
        Manage AOC container.

        Only the following fields are allowed to be changed:
        • Managing the Application Name (CRED_FIELD_NAME).
        • Managing the AOC's PIN/Password (CRED_FIELD_SECRET).
        • Managing the AOC's retaining orphaned applet status (CRED_FIELD_RETAIN_ORPHAN).

        AOC container's credential (PIN/Password) is used for for AUTH_INTERNAL type of authentication requiring a follow up extendedRequest() method which will return 1 for successful execution from extendedRequest() and 0 for failed execution.
        Parameters:
        fieldType - Field type as listed above that requires editing
        input - Input for selectors' list above
        offset - Offset into selectors' list
        len - Length of selector input
        output - 8 bytes of nonce to be signed
        outOffset - Offset of buffer storing 8 bytes of nonce to be signed
        Returns:
        8 bytes of nonce to be signed

      • getAOCInfo

        short getAOCInfo(byte targetProfileFieldSearch,
                 byte[] output,
                 short outOffset)
        Get AOC public information.

        No authentication is needed. The API method call must originate from a registered applet.

        Expired containers will result in inability to query for public information and can be used as indicator (without needing authentication) as to whether an AOC container has expired or not.
        Field Description
        CRED_FIELD_IDPUBKEY Container's ECC-P256R1 Identity Public Key
        CRED_FIELD_NAME Container's name
        CRED_FIELD_ACTIVE Activity status of Container. CRED_STAT_INIT for newly initialized Container, CRED_STAT_ACTIVE for active Containers and CRED_STAT_INACTIVE for inactive Containers.
        CRED_FIELD_MANAGEMENT N/A
        CRED_FIELD_CREDID Unique user ID within AOC container environment because AOC container is itself also a limited and non-administrative special user type.
        CRED_FIELD_SECRET_TYPE Secret type. CRED_CLASS_PIN for PIN type and CRED_CLASS_PWD for Password type.
        CRED_FIELD_MAX_RETRIES Maximum authentication retry before AOC container credential is locked. Once AOC container's credential is locked, functions requiring it including UISession will not be accessible.
        CRED_FIELD_CREATE Creation timestamp of AOC container. 4 bytes UNIX.
        CRED_FIELD_EXPIRE Expiry timestamp of AOC container. 4 bytes UNIX.
        CRED_FIELD_ATTEST AOC container's Attestation Certificate to attest for container's creation within the T101 environment.
        CRED_FIELD_OID AOC Container's OID (32 byte AOC UUID).
        CRED_FIELD_OBJCTR AOC container's object creation counter used within Attestation Certificate generation for asymmetric keypair objects (ECC and RSA keypair types) that are natively generated within the AOC container that enables Attested Key Generation function.
        Parameters:
        targetProfileFieldSearch - Target search profile field
        output - Output for storing public information queried
        outOffset - Output offset for storing public information queried
        Returns:
        Output length of public information queried

      • newAOCUserCred

        boolean newAOCUserCred(byte secretType,
                       byte[] secret,
                       short secOffset,
                       short secLen,
                       short maxRetry,
                       byte[] username,
                       short usernameOffset,
                       short usernameLen,
                       byte[] expireTS,
                       short etsOffset,
                       byte credFieldType,
                       byte[] credInput,
                       short cOffset,
                       short cLen,
                       byte authMethod,
                       byte[] output,
                       short outOffset)
        Creates a new non-Global user credential.

        In the AOC container creation phase, the AOC container's credential is used to authenticate and create a new AOC user.

        Once an AOC container has been finalized, the container's credential will not be used for creating a new AOC user. Only an existing administrator's credential will be used for creating new AOC user.

        The administrator is to provide a default PIN/Password for the user and the administrator must ask the users to change their PIN/Password manually.

        Secret Type Secret Description Maximum Retry Allowed To Be Set
        CRED_CLASS_PIN Numerical PIN (0 to 9) with a maximum of 32 characters 99 maximum retry allowed to be set
        CRED_CLASS_PWD Alpha-numerical Password with ASCII printable characters with a maximum of 32 characters 99 maximum retry allowed to be set

        Parameters:
        secretType - Secret type of AOC user authentication secret
        secret - Secret buffer storing AOC user authentication secret
        secOffset - Secret buffer offset storing AOC user authentication secret
        secLen - Secret buffer length storing AOC user authentication secret
        maxRetry - Maximum retry for authenticating to AOC user credential
        username - Name buffer of the AOC user with ASCII printable non-symbolic characters allowed
        usernameOffset - Offset of name buffer
        usernameLen - Length of name buffer with maximum length of name to be 15 bytes
        expireTS - Expiry timestamp buffer for AOC user expiration. Set expiry timestamp to 00000000 to have no expiration.
        etsOffset - Offset into expiry timestamp buffer.
        credFieldType - Caller's credential field type used for authentication (i.e. CRED_FIELD_NAME for using username to authenticate)
        credInput - Caller's authentication field input
        cOffset - Caller's authentication field input offset
        cLen - Caller's authentication field input length (i.e. length of username if CRED_FIELD_NAME is used)
        authMethod - Credential authentication method (AUTH_INTERNAL for Internal authentication requiring an additional extendedRequest() method or AUTH_FRONTPANEL that will use the Front Panel for PIN/Password input)
        output - Buffer for storing nonce to be signed if authentication AUTH_INTERNAL
        outOffset - Buffer for nonce to be signed offset
        Returns:
        If AUTH_INTERNAL authentication is used, it will return true whereby an extendedRequest() method is to be followed up and after the extendedRequest() is called, a return value of 1 indicates success and 0 indicates failure of operation and any other value are also indicators of failure. If AUTH_FRONTPANEL authentication is used, a true is returned for successful operation and false is returned for failed operation.

      • manageUserCred

        boolean manageUserCred(byte fieldType,
                       byte[] input,
                       short offset,
                       short len,
                       byte[] output,
                       short outOffset,
                       byte credFieldType,
                       byte[] credInput,
                       short cOffset,
                       short cLen,
                       byte authMethod)
        Management of AOC user's own credential.

        Authentication by the user is required. Only the user may manage themselves. Administrators do not have the right to manage a user's own credential other than resetting their PIN/Password with the resetAOCUserCred() method.

        Users may edit the following fields in their own credential profile:
        • Managing the AOC User's Name (CRED_FIELD_NAME).
        • Managing the AOC User's PIN/Password (CRED_FIELD_SECRET).


        Global users will not be able to use this method to manage their Global credential. They will need to use the GOC applet to manage their credential.
        Parameters:
        fieldType - Field type to manage according to table above.
        input - Buffer containing field input
        offset - Offset into buffer containing field input
        len - Length of field content
        output - Buffer for storing nonce to be signed if authentication AUTH_INTERNAL
        outOffset - Buffer for nonce to be signed offset
        credFieldType - Caller's credential field type used for authentication (i.e. CRED_FIELD_NAME for using username to authenticate)
        credInput - Caller's authentication field input
        cOffset - Caller's authentication field input offset
        cLen - Caller's authentication field input length (i.e. length of username if CRED_FIELD_NAME is used)
        authMethod - Credential authentication method (AUTH_INTERNAL for Internal authentication requiring an additional extendedRequest() method or AUTH_FRONTPANEL that will use the Front Panel for PIN/Password input)
        Returns:
        If AUTH_INTERNAL authentication is used, it will return true whereby an extendedRequest() method is to be followed up and after the extendedRequest() is called, a return value of 1 indicates success and 0 indicates failure of operation and any other value are also indicators of failure. If AUTH_FRONTPANEL authentication is used, a true is returned for successful operation and false is returned for failed operation.

      • resetAOCUserCred

        boolean resetAOCUserCred(byte[] input,
                         short offset,
                         short len,
                         byte[] username,
                         short usernameOffset,
                         short usernameLen,
                         byte credFieldType,
                         byte[] credInput,
                         short cOffset,
                         short cLen,
                         byte authMethod,
                         byte[] output,
                         short outOffset)
        Resets a AOC user's credential PIN/Password.

        An existing administrator of the AOC container may perform resetting of a non-Global user and supplying a new default password for the AOC user credential.

        It is the responsibility of the administrator to inform the AOC user to change their PIN/Password after a reset has occured.

        Administrator need to query target user's credential secret type before provisioning a new default credential secret.
        Parameters:
        input - New default credential secret (PIN/Password)
        offset - New credential secret buffer offset
        len - New credential secret length (≤ 32 bytes)
        username - Name of the target AOC user to reset
        usernameOffset - Buffer offset containing name
        usernameLen - Length of name of the target AOC user to reset
        credFieldType - Caller's credential field type used for authentication (i.e. CRED_FIELD_NAME for using username to authenticate)
        credInput - Caller's authentication field input
        cOffset - Caller's authentication field input offset
        cLen - Caller's authentication field input length (i.e. length of username if CRED_FIELD_NAME is used)
        authMethod - Credential authentication method (AUTH_INTERNAL for Internal authentication requiring an additional extendedRequest() method or AUTH_FRONTPANEL that will use the Front Panel for PIN/Password input)
        output - Buffer for storing nonce to be signed if authentication AUTH_INTERNAL
        outOffset - Buffer for nonce to be signed offset
        Returns:
        If AUTH_INTERNAL authentication is used, it will return true whereby an extendedRequest() method is to be followed up and after the extendedRequest() is called, a return value of 1 indicates success and 0 indicates failure of operation and any other value are also indicators of failure. If AUTH_FRONTPANEL authentication is used, a true is returned for successful operation and false is returned for failed operation.

      • listAOCUsers

        short listAOCUsers(byte credFieldType,
                   byte[] credInput,
                   short cOffset,
                   short cLen,
                   byte[] output,
                   short outOffset,
                   byte authMethod)
        Generates a list of all AOC users including Global Users that are part of an AOC container regardless whether these Global Users have their Front Panel management setting disabled.

        This method call can only be called by users with AOC container administrative privileges.

        Decoding method for user list:
        [Credential Block #1] ... [Credential Block #N]

        Credential Block decoding method:
        [User Position][User Cred ID][Admin Flag][Active Status][Name Length][Name]
        Field Field Size (bytes) Description
        User Position 1 Position of user in the AOC user list
        User Credential ID 1 Unique Credential ID
        Admin Flag 1 FF for administrator and 00 for normal user permission
        Active Status 1 CRED_STAT_INIT for newly initialized user, CRED_STAT_ACTIVE for active user and CRED_STAT_INACTIVE for inactive user
        Name length 1 Length of name
        Name Name length above Name/td>

        Note: The returned list item count length only states the amount of list item objects rather than the total list data length. Above parsing method must be employed to parse output data buffer.
        Parameters:
        credFieldType - Caller's credential field type used for authentication (i.e. CRED_FIELD_NAME for using username to authenticate)
        credInput - Caller's authentication field input
        cOffset - Caller's authentication field input offset
        cLen - Caller's authentication field input length (i.e. length of username if CRED_FIELD_NAME is used)
        output - Buffer for storing nonce to be signed if authentication AUTH_INTERNAL otherwise when using AUTH_FRONTPANEL, if successful, the output buffer will contain a list of users in the AOC container.
        outOffset - Buffer for nonce to be signed offset if AUTH_INTERNAL is used otherwise when using AUTH_FRONTPANEL, if successful, the output buffer will contain a list of users in the AOC container.
        authMethod - Credential authentication method (AUTH_INTERNAL for Internal authentication requiring an additional extendedRequest() method or AUTH_FRONTPANEL that will use the Front Panel for PIN/Password input)
        Returns:
        If AUTH_INTERNAL authentication is used, it will return 8 bytes of nonce whereby an extendedRequest() method is to be followed up and after the extendedRequest() is called, a return value of the user list item count length will be returned if successful and -1 if failed. If AUTH_FRONTPANEL authentication is used, a return value of the user list item count length will be returned if successful and -1 if failed.

      • getUserInfo

        short getUserInfo(byte credFieldType,
                  byte[] credInput,
                  short cOffset,
                  short cLen,
                  byte targetFieldType,
                  byte[] targetInput,
                  short targetOffset,
                  short targetLen,
                  byte targetProfileFieldSearch,
                  byte[] output,
                  short outOffset,
                  byte authMethod)
        Get user information of other AOC users.

        Can be used by any AOC users with authentication.
        Field Description
        CRED_FIELD_NAME Container's name
        CRED_FIELD_ACTIVE Activity status of user. CRED_STAT_INIT for newly initialized user, CRED_STAT_ACTIVE for active user and CRED_STAT_INACTIVE for inactive user.
        CRED_FIELD_MANAGEMENT 01 for Front Panel management enabled, other values for Front Panel management disabled. Only usable for users whom are Global user type.
        CRED_FIELD_CREDID Unique ID to identify user within AOC environment. A highly reliable search field besides username.
        CRED_FIELD_SECRET_TYPE Secret type. CRED_CLASS_PIN for PIN type and CRED_CLASS_PWD for Password type.
        CRED_FIELD_MAX_RETRIES Maximum authentication retry before AOC user credential is locked. Once AOC container's user is locked, functions requiring it including will not be accessible. If user is an administrator or GOC user, a locked credential can NEVER be reset again.
        CRED_FIELD_CREATE Creation timestamp of AOC user. 4 bytes UNIX.
        CRED_FIELD_EXPIRE Expiry timestamp of AOC user. 4 bytes UNIX.
        CRED_FIELD_ATTEST N/A.
        CRED_FIELD_OID N/A.
        CRED_FIELD_OBJCTR AOC container's object creation counter used within Attestation Certificate generation for asymmetric keypair objects (ECC and RSA keypair types) that are natively generated within the AOC container that enables Attested Key Generation function.
        Parameters:
        credFieldType - Caller's credential field type used for authentication (i.e. CRED_FIELD_NAME for using username to authenticate)
        credInput - Caller's authentication field input
        cOffset - Caller's authentication field input offset
        cLen - Caller's authentication field input length (i.e. length of username if CRED_FIELD_NAME is used)
        targetFieldType - Field type to for querying target user (i.e. CRED_FIELD_NAME for using username to set as target of query)
        targetInput - Buffer containing field input (i.e. CRED_FIELD_NAME for containing username of target user for query)
        targetOffset - Offset into buffer containing field input
        targetLen - Length of data within buffer containing field input
        targetProfileFieldSearch - Field for searching target user
        output - Buffer for storing nonce to be signed if authentication AUTH_INTERNAL otherwise when using AUTH_FRONTPANEL, if successful, the output buffer will contain result of a query
        outOffset - Buffer for nonce to be signed offset if AUTH_INTERNAL is used otherwise when using AUTH_FRONTPANEL, if successful, the output buffer will contain result of a query
        authMethod - Credential authentication method (AUTH_INTERNAL for Internal authentication requiring an additional extendedRequest() method or AUTH_FRONTPANEL that will use the Front Panel for PIN/Password input)
        Returns:
        If AUTH_INTERNAL authentication is used, it will return 8 bytes of nonce whereby an extendedRequest() method is to be followed up and after the extendedRequest() is called, a return value of the user list item count length will be returned if successful and -1 if failed. If AUTH_FRONTPANEL authentication is used, a return value of the output buffer will contain result of a query.

      • importLocalGlobalUserCredToAOC

        boolean importLocalGlobalUserCredToAOC(byte credFieldType,
                                       byte[] credInput,
                                       short cOffset,
                                       short cLen,
                                       byte[] input,
                                       short offset,
                                       short len,
                                       byte[] output,
                                       short outOffset,
                                       byte authMethod)
        Allows importing of a Global User into an AOC container user group. TYhis can only be done by an AOC administrator or when the AOC container have not been finalized, the AOC container itself has the permission to import the Global Users. Imported Global Users are not automatically accepted into the AOC container until the Global User enters the 'Front Panel' mode or via the GOC applet and access their inbox to accept the invitation into an AOC container user group.
        Parameters:

      • deleteObject

        boolean deleteObject(byte[] input,
                     short offset,
                     short len,
                     byte[] output,
                     short outOffset,
                     byte credFieldType,
                     byte[] credInput,
                     short credOffset,
                     short credLen,
                     byte authMethod)
        Deletes and destroys an object in an AOC container.

        If the AOC container is in 'Unadministrable' mode where there is no Administrator users in the container environment, the object's ACL will be triggered and allow any authorized container user within the AOC container environment to delete the object if the object has a ACL_EDIT permission enabled.

        If the AOC container has at least 1 administrator user, it is considered an 'Administable' state and only an administrator has the ability to delete the object.
        Parameters:
        input - Object handle's input buffer
        offset - Offset into the object handle's buffer
        len - Length of the object handle
        output - Output of signed nonce to be signed if AUTH_INTERNAL is used otherwise no output will be available except the success or failure of operation.
        outOffset - Offset of the signed nonce to be signed
        credFieldType - Caller's AOC container credential type (i.e. CRED_FIELD_NAME for userame) authentication
        credInput - Input buffer containing AOC container credential (i.e. username when CRED_FIELD_NAME is used)
        credOffset - Offset into the credential input buffer
        credLen - Length of the credential input
        authMethod - Credential authentication method (AUTH_INTERNAL for Internal authentication requiring an additional extendedRequest() method or AUTH_FRONTPANEL that will use the Front Panel for PIN/Password input)
        Returns:
        If AUTH_INTERNAL authentication is used, it will return true whereby an extendedRequest() method is to be followed up and after the extendedRequest() is called, a return value of 1 indicates success and 0 indicates failure of operation and any other value are also indicators of failure. If AUTH_FRONTPANEL authentication is used, a true is returned for successful operation and false is returned for failed operation.

      • extendedRequest

        short extendedRequest(byte[] input,
                      short offset,
                      short len,
                      byte[] output,
                      short outOffset)
        Extending request of an AUTH_INTERNAL authenticated call to a function requiring authentication.
        Parameters:
        input - Signed nonce input
        offset - Signed nonce offset
        len - Signed nonce length
        output - Buffer for storing expected result output from an authenticating function
        outOffset - Offset into the result buffer
        Returns:
        Amount of bytes of expected output. A return result of -1 indicates a possible error in execution.

      • importExportObject

        short importExportObject(boolean isCredential,
                         byte action,
                         byte subAction,
                         byte[] input,
                         short offset,
                         short len,
                         byte[] secInput,
                         short secOffset,
                         short secLen,
                         byte[] sec1Input,
                         short sec1Offset,
                         short sec1Len,
                         byte[] output,
                         short outOffset,
                         byte credFieldType,
                         byte[] credInput,
                         short cOffset,
                         short cLen,
                         byte authMethod)
        Allows exporting of credentials and importing and exporting of generic and key objects from the Key Manager.

        Credentials are not allowed to be imported for security reasons.

        Exporting and importing of generic and key objects may use wrapped export and import methods with the usage of 256-bit AES key and an arbitrary HMAC-SHA256 key size of bigger than 0 bytes and no upper limits on the HMAC key size.

        It is advisable to keep the HMAC key at the size of no more than 256-bit length as the HMAC key has to be transported over a global buffer (typically the APDU buffer) and a typical APDU buffer only supports up to 262 bytes of data.

        Action Object Type Import/Export Source Import/Export Security
        Import Generic Object Buffered Data via bufferData() upload Import is not restricted. No admin required. Allow secure wrapped import
        Import Key Object Buffered Data via bufferData() upload Import is not restricted. No admin required. Allow secure wrapped import
        Export Generic Object Buffered Data via bufferData() upload Export permission and ACL READ permission applicable. Allow secure wrapped export
        Export Key Object Buffered Data via bufferData() upload Export permission and ACL READ permission applicable. Allow secure wrapped export
        Export Credential Object Buffered Data via bufferData() download No permission needed. No private key or PIN/Password will be available in exported credential.

        Note: Import source that utilizes bufferData() function must have import data uploaded before calling the importExportObject() function. Export source listed above that utilizes the bufferData() will not return the data via successful execution. The exported data will be preloaded into the temporary buffer for the authorized applet to download via the AOC container credential.
        Operation Description
        ACT_OBJ_IMPORT Import of generic and key object types. May utilize secure wrapped imports if the import data blob requires secure wrapping/unwrapping.
        ACT_OBJ_EXPORT_PUBLIC Export public data. If secure wrapping is used, only a HMAC-SHA256 MAC over the export blob will be computed due to no private data being exposed, no encryption will be done.
        ACT_OBJ_EXPORT_PRIVATE Export private data. If secure wrapping is used, a HMAC-SDA256 MAC over the export blob will be computed and if the object contains private or secret data, the private data will be encrypted with AES-256-CBC-PKCS5 using the encryption key supplied by the caller before the MAC is computed in a Encrypt-then-MAC fashion.

        Note: If an object is imported with an Attestation Certificate and then re-exported (securely or insecurely), its accompanying Attestation Certificate will not be included in the re-exporting blob due to the object being in a foreign container environment and the attestation is not relevant to the foreign container's context anymore.
        Parameters:
        isCredential - Indicates if import or export function is a credential import/export operation
        action - Indicates the types of import or export operation
        subAction - If ACT_OBJ_SIZE is used in export calls to generate estimated export size only with the total estimated export blob will be returned as a result and no actual export will occur otherwise an actual export will be written to the buffered data region for reading. Import function will omit this part.
        input - Use in export of non-credential objects to specify the object handle name for export or calculation of export size.
        offset - Input offset
        len - Input length
        secInput - Security Input for AES-256 Blob Encryption Key
        secOffset - Security Input offset
        secLen - Security Input length (must be 32 bytes or 256-bits)
        sec1Input - Security Input 1 for HMAC-SHA256 Blob MAC key
        sec1Offset - Security Input 1 offset
        sec1Len - Security Input 1 length (more than 0 bytes and as many bytes as the global array can transport)
        output - Output for nonce signing for AUTH_INTERNAL authentication case. If AUTH_FRONTPANEL is used, no output is expected.
        outOffset - Output offset for storing nonce for AUTH_INTERNAL authentication case. If AUTH_FRONTPANEL is used, no output is expected.
        credFieldType - Caller's AOC credential field type (i.e. CRED_FIELD_NAME)
        credInput - Caller's AOC credential field input (i.e. Username if CRED_FIELD_NAME is used)
        cOffset - Caller's AOC credential field offset
        cLen - Caller's AOC credential field length
        authMethod - Credential authentication method (AUTH_INTERNAL for Internal authentication requiring an additional extendedRequest() method or AUTH_FRONTPANEL that will use the Front Panel for PIN/Password input)
        Returns:
        If AUTH_INTERNAL authentication is used, 8 bytes of nonce is expected to be signed by the caller. If AUTH_FRONTPANEL is used, the number of expected resulting bytes from the import/export is given which the caller must then use the bufferData() method to retrieve the output.

      • cryptoChaCha20

        short cryptoChaCha20(byte[] key,
                     short keyOffset,
                     byte[] nonce,
                     short nonceOffset,
                     byte[] counter,
                     short ctrOffset,
                     byte[] input,
                     short inOffset,
                     short length,
                     byte[] output,
                     short outOffset)
        Cryptographic assistant function. Allows any registered or unregistered applets to use the internal ChaCha20-RFC7539 engine without needing to re-implement their own ChaCha20 engine.

        Utilizes source code with owner's permission from here.

        Highly recommended to only use the ChaCha20 crypto-assistant function with input data of no bigger than 200 bytes due to the user needing to use a global buffer (i.e. APDU) as the processing buffer for temporary process storage. With a typical APDU buffer only supporting up to 262 bytes of buffer space, anything bigger than 200 bytes of input would not be usable.
        Parameters:
        key - Cryptographic key buffer
        keyOffset - Key offset
        nonce - Nonce input buffer
        nonceOffset - Nonce input offset
        counter - Counter input buffer
        ctrOffset - Counter input offset
        input - Input message for transformation buffer
        inOffset - Input message offset
        length - Input message length
        output - Output message buffer
        outOffset - Output message offset
        Returns:
        Length of output

      • cryptoHMAC

        short cryptoHMAC(byte hashType,
                 byte[] key,
                 short keyOffset,
                 short keyLength,
                 byte[] msg,
                 short mOff,
                 short mLen,
                 byte[] ipad,
                 short offIPad,
                 byte[] opad,
                 short offOPad,
                 byte[] secB,
                 short offSecB,
                 byte[] oMsg,
                 short outOff)
        Cryptographic assistant function. Allows any registered or unregistered applets to use the internal HMAC engine without needing to re-implement their own HMAC engine.

        Highly recommended to only use the HMAC crypto-assistant function with HMAC-SHA256 due to the user needing to use a global buffer (i.e. APDU) as the processing buffer for temporary process storage. With a typical APDU buffer only supporting up to 262 bytes of buffer space, anything bigger than HMAC-SHA256 would not be usable.

        HMAC-SHA1 and HMAC-MD5 are not supported as they are deemed insecure and depreciated.
        Parameters:
        hashType - MessageDigest constants for hash types
        key - Key byte array input
        keyOffset - Key byte array offset
        keyLength - Key byte length
        msg - Message byte array input
        mOff - Message input offset
        mLen - Message length
        ipad - HMAC IPAD buffer array
        offIPad - HMAC IPAD buffer offset
        opad - HMAC OPAD buffer array
        offOPad - HMAC OPAD buffer offset
        secB - HMAC internal keystream buffer
        offSecB - HMAC internal keystream offset
        oMsg - Message output buffer
        outOff - Message output offset
        Returns:
        Length of output

      • uiSession

        short uiSession(byte uiType,
                byte uiSubMode,
                byte uiSubMode1,
                byte uiSubMode2,
                byte uiSubMode3,
                byte[] title,
                short titleOffset,
                short titleLen,
                byte[] input,
                short inOffset,
                short inLen,
                byte[] output,
                short outOffset)
        Executes UI Session. Requires AOC authentication from registered applets. AUTH_INTERNAL is the only selected authentication method. The first round of output will return an 8 byte nonce as an output to be signed via HMAC-SHA256 using the PIN/Password of the AOC container. The return value must be 8 to indicate 8 bytes of nonce for signing. An extendedRequest() method must follow whereby the output and return value of the extendedRequest() is the final output and return value.
        uiType
        UI_TYPE_T_USER_LIST
        UI_TYPE_TEXT
        UI_TYPE_QR
        UI_TYPE_INPUT
        UI_TYPE_LIST

        UI_TYPE_T_USER_LIST Parameters Parameter descriptions
        uiSubMode NULL
        uiSubMode1 NULL
        uiSubMode2 NULL
        uiSubMode3 NULL

        UI_TYPE_TEXT Parameters Parameter descriptions
        uiSubMode NULL
        uiSubMode1 NULL
        uiSubMode2 NULL
        uiSubMode3 NULL

        UI_TYPE_QR Parameters Parameter descriptions
        uiSubMode NULL
        uiSubMode1 NULL
        uiSubMode2 NULL
        uiSubMode3 NULL

        UI_TYPE_INPUT Parameters Parameter descriptions
        uiSubMode keypadMode (KEYPAD_PIN_MODE = 01, KEYPAD_ALPHA_MODE = 02, KEYPAD_ALPHA_SMALL_MODE = 03, KEYPAD_HEX_MODE = 04, KEYPAD_SYM_MODE = 05)
        uiSubMode1 keypadSubMode (KEYPAD_RESTRICT_PIN_ONLY = 01, KEYPAD_RESTRICT_ALPHA_ONLY = 01, KEYPAD_RESTRICT_SYM_ACCESS = 02)
        uiSubMode2 isSecret (0xFF for True)
        uiSubMode3 maximum input length ≤ 128

        UI_TYPE_LIST Parameters Parameter descriptions
        uiSubMode loop (FF - true, 00 - false)
        uiSubMode1 itemCount not more than 6 items
        uiSubMode2 NULL
        uiSubMode3 NULL

        uiType Input description
        UI_TYPE_T_USER_LIST No input required.
        UI_TYPE_TEXT Printable ASCII characters with length up to maximum of 128 bytes
        UI_TYPE_QR Binary length up to maximum of 128 bytes
        UI_TYPE_INPUT Printable ASCII characters with length up to maximum of 16 bytes
        UI_TYPE_LIST Array of bytes consisting of length in 1 byte followed by data content of printable ASCII characters of not more than 15 bytes per item.
        [Item1Len][Item1] ... [ItemNLen][ItemN].

        uiType Output and return value description
        UI_TYPE_T_USER_LIST Default return value is 1. Output will be a 1 byte containing user position in AOC user group list.
        UI_TYPE_TEXT Returns 0 for Cancel button press. Returns 1 for OK button press. Returns 2 for either timeout session. No output.
        UI_TYPE_QR Returns 0 for Cancel button press. Returns 1 for OK button press. Returns 2 for either timeout session. No output.
        UI_TYPE_INPUT Returns length of input. Output contains input content.
        UI_TYPE_LIST Array of bytes consisting of length in 1 byte followed by data content of printable ASCII characters of not more than 15 bytes per item.
        [Item1Len][Item1] ... [ItemNLen][ItemN].
        Parameters:
        uiType - View above table for acceptable uiType.
        uiSubMode - View above table for acceptable uiSubMode.
        uiSubMode1 - View above table for acceptable uiSubMode1.
        uiSubMode2 - View above table for acceptable uiSubMode2.
        uiSubMode3 - View above table for acceptable uiSubMode3.
        title - Title (Printable non-symbolic ASCII with a length of 9 characters as maximum)
        titleOffset - Offset of title
        titleLen - Title length
        input - Input data for processing or display
        inOffset - Offset into input data for processing or display
        inLen - Length of input data for processing or display
        output - Output buffer
        outOffset - Output buffer offset
        Returns:
        8 bytes of nonce for signing.

      • isSessionBusy

        boolean isSessionBusy()
        Checks if the session is busy in the Key Manager.

        No authentication is required and any registered or unregistered applets may call this method.
        Returns:
        boolean value regarding the session busy state.

      • resetSession

        void resetSession()
        Resets a busy session by a registered applet.

        No authentication is required to prevent session locking complications.

        Use this method with care as other applets might be in the process of an existing session.

      • bufferData

        short bufferData(boolean isWrite,
                 short newMaxLen,
                 byte[] input,
                 short offset,
                 short len,
                 short buffStartOff,
                 byte[] output,
                 short outOffset)
        Allows a registered applet to temporarily store larger amounts of data into a temporary data buffer on the Key Manager's side.

        The AOC container authentication must be used to over AUTH_INTERNAL authentication method. AUTH_INTERNAL authentication method is implicitly selected and cannot be overwritten hence a follow up extendedRequest() must be used.

        For reading operations, the extendedRequest() will return from its output the data to be read and the length of the data that has been read. For writing operations, the extendedRequest() will return the length of data that has been successfully written to the temporary buffer.

        No unregistered applets are allowed to access this function.

        If the temporary buffer has already been assigned to an existing registered applet, it will be atomically locked and prevented access by other registered applets from accessing it until any registered applets were to call the clearBuffer() call to break the lock and clear the buffer.
        Maximum buffered data is 1800 bytes.

        Temporary buffer utilizes a persistent memory and this operation must be used carefully to preserve lifespan of the persistent memory for writing into the buffer.
        Parameters:
        isWrite - Whether the buffer operation is a writing operation or reading operation
        newMaxLen - If newMaxLen is set, it will clear the buffer if there is no applet session assignment and create a new buffer with the new maximum length
        input - For writing operation, input data for writing to the temporary data buffer
        offset - Offset into the input data for writing operation
        len - Length of reading or writing operation
        buffStartOff - Offset into temporary buffer for writing or reading
        output - Output for nonce to be signed
        outOffset - Output offset for storing nonce
        Returns:
        8 bytes of nonce

      • getBufferDataLength

        short getBufferDataLength()
        Retrieves current temporary data buffer usage length.

        Any applet including applets that are not registered with the Key Manager may access this method.
        Returns:
        length of currently stored buffered data.

      • clearBuffer

        short clearBuffer(byte[] output,
                  short outOffset)
        Clears the temporary data buffer and resets the accessing applet permission back to no specific registered applets. AOC container authentication is required with default AUTH_INTERNAL authentication mode by default.
        Parameters:
        output - Output for nonce to be signed
        outOffset - Output offset for storing nonce
        Returns:
        8 bytes of nonce

      • hexStrToBin

        short hexStrToBin(byte[] input,
                  short offset,
                  byte[] output,
                  short outOffset,
                  short len)
        Converts hexadecimal ASCII string representation to binary array.

        Example: Converts string of 'helloworld' in it's ASCII hexadecimal representation of ASCIIfied '3638363536633663366637373666373236633634' to binary representation in byte array of '68656c6c6f776f726c64'.
        Parameters:
        input - ASCIIfied hexadecimal representation input
        offset - Offset into ASCIIfied hexadecimal representation input
        output - Output containing binary array of conversion from ASCIIfied hexadecimal representation input
        outOffset - Output offset for binary array
        len - Length of input containing ASCIIfied hexadecimal representation input
        Returns:
        Length of output
